alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Eastern Cherry; Garden; Grant; Hooker; Keith; McPherson; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:23AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Arthur, southwestern Cherry, Grant, northwestern Keith, Hooker, Garden, northwestern McPherson and southeastern Sheridan Counties through 330 AM CDT/230 AM MDT/... At 223 AM CDT/123 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 26 miles southwest of Medicine Lake to near Ashby to 9 miles northwest of Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Arthur, Ellsworth, Hyannis, Swan Lake, Whitman, Ashby, Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge, Big Hill, Dogtown Flats, Dipping Vat Meadow, Billys Lake, Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road, Miles Lake, Marsh Flat, Whitman Road crossing the North Branch of the Middle Loup River, Pratt Lake, Sevenmile Hill, Shimmons Lake and Haythorn Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 12. Highway 2 between mile markers 101 and 194. Highway 61 between mile markers 106 and 200. Highway 92 between mile markers 125 and 131, and between mile markers 165 and 187. Highway 97 between mile markers 44 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT/300 AM MDT/ for the Panhandle of, north central and west central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Eastern Cherry; Garden; Grant; Hooker; Keith; McPherson; Sheridan; Western Cherry
